guide.conclusion: It remains to be seen how well the adhesive on the hubs will hold up over time. If this were a door that were frequently opened and closed, I might be a bit more concerned about the hubs eventually working loose and falling off. Stay tuned for updates.

guide.introduction: These stick-on CD/DVD hubs are marketed to publishers who want to include an optical disc in a book, card, folder, or other printed matter. They cost pennies apiece and, with the aid of the attached print-and-cut template, are easily arranged in a hexagonal grid on any smooth surface you might want to use for disc storage. Discs stored this way are easy to browse at a glance, without flipping pages, and don't take up space on a table or shelf.
guide.introduction_rendered:
These stick-on CD/DVD hubs are marketed to publishers who want to include an optical disc in a book, card, folder, or other printed matter. They cost pennies apiece and, with the aid of the attached print-and-cut template, are easily arranged in a hexagonal grid on any smooth surface you might want to use for disc storage. Discs stored this way are easy to browse at a glance, without flipping pages, and don't take up space on a table or shelf.

Relevant parts
  • Adhesive CD/DVD hubs
Tools
  • Cloth
  • Hole punch
  • Marker
  • Measuring tape
  • Paper cutter
  • Printer

lines.text: Choose a surface.
lines.text_raw: Choose a surface.

lines.text: My home-office door is almost never closed and the back was not in great shape to begin with.  I was therefore not too concerned about messing up the finish, but you may want to be more careful.
lines.text_raw: My home-office door is almost never closed and the back was not in great shape to begin with.  I was therefore not too concerned about messing up the finish, but you may want to be more careful.

lines.text: The surface needs to be smooth enough for the hubs to stick.  Besides a door, a mirror or a piece of cardboard or masonite hung on the wall would work.
lines.text_raw: The surface needs to be smooth enough for the hubs to stick.  Besides a door, a mirror or a piece of cardboard or masonite hung on the wall would work.

lines.text: Draw a plan.
lines.text_raw: Draw a plan.

lines.text: I used Adobe Illustrator to figure out how many discs I could fit on the door and how I wanted to lay them out, but InkScape, SketchUp, or plain old pen and paper would also work just fine.
lines.text_raw: I used Adobe Illustrator to figure out how many discs I could fit on the door and how I wanted to lay them out, but [http://inkscape.org/|InkScape], [http://sketchup.google.com/|SketchUp], or plain old pen and paper would also work just fine.

lines.text: A full-size CD is 120 mm across with a 15 mm hole. The template allows for 15 mm of clearance between CDs, as well, which puts them 135 mm apart on-center.
lines.text_raw: A full-size CD is 120 mm across with a 15 mm hole. The template allows for 15 mm of clearance between CDs, as well, which puts them 135 mm apart on-center.

lines.text: Print template at full size on heavy paper.
lines.text_raw: Print template at full size on heavy paper.

lines.text: Cut out along dotted lines.
lines.text_raw: Cut out along dotted lines.

lines.text: I used a swing-arm paper cutter, but a pair of scissors or an art knife and straightedge would work just as well.
lines.text_raw: I used a swing-arm paper cutter, but a pair of scissors or an art knife and straightedge would work just as well.

lines.text: Punch holes.
lines.text_raw: Punch holes.

lines.text: If you cut the template edges accurately, a US-style single-hole punch centered on each short edge should put a hole in just the right place.
lines.text_raw: If you cut the template edges accurately, a US-style single-hole punch centered on each short edge should put a hole in just the right place.

lines.text: The holes do not have to be precisely positioned, so it's OK if you miss the black circle by a little bit.
lines.text_raw: The holes do not have to be precisely positioned, so it's OK if you miss the black circle by a little bit.

lines.text: Use an erasable marker to do your layout work.  You may want to perform a discrete test, first, to verify its erasability.  I used a wet-erase overhead projection marker.
lines.text_raw: Use an erasable marker to do your layout work.  You may want to perform a discrete test, first, to verify its erasability.  I used a wet-erase overhead projection marker.

lines.text: Measure and mark centerline and position of first CD.
lines.text_raw: Measure and mark centerline and position of first CD.

lines.text: I measured and marked the center of the door at the top edge, and right above the knob, and connected those two marks with a line.
lines.text_raw: I measured and marked the center of the door at the top edge, and right above the knob, and connected those two marks with a line.

lines.text: Then I measured 16 cm down from the top edge, along the line, and made a witness mark to position the center of the top CD.
lines.text_raw: Then I measured 16 cm down from the top edge, along the line, and made a witness mark to position the center of the top CD.

lines.text: Iterate template over surface and mark grid locations.
lines.text_raw: Iterate template over surface and mark grid locations.

lines.text: Start with your witness mark, and work along the centerline first.
lines.text_raw: Start with your witness mark, and work along the centerline first.

lines.text: Once you've got the center column of discs positioned, finish out toward the edges.
lines.text_raw: Once you've got the center column of discs positioned, finish out toward the edges.

lines.text: Peel the adhesive off the back of each hub, center it over one of your grid marks, and stick it in place.
lines.text_raw: Peel the adhesive off the back of each hub, center it over one of your grid marks, and stick it in place.

lines.text: Once all the hubs are attached, erase any remaining layout marks, e.g. with a damp cloth.
lines.text_raw: Once all the hubs are attached, erase any remaining layout marks, e.g. with a damp cloth.

lines.text: Click your discs onto the hubs, and you're done!
lines.text_raw: Click your discs onto the hubs, and you're done!
